# cancel()

**Instance Method**

Cancels progress tracking.

## Declaration

```swift
func cancel()
```

## Discussion

This method invokes the block for [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/cancellationHandler], if there is one, and ensures that any subsequent reads of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isCancelled] property return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

If the receiver has suboperations, the system cancels their progress as well.

## Controlling Progress

- **pause()**: Pauses progress tracking.
- **resume()**: Resumes progress tracking.
- **resumingHandler**: The block to invoke when progress resumes.

items.description: The block to invoke when progress resumes.
items.name: resumingHandler
